notes.text: Update that provide Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4.1 and fix several bugs, and add various enhancements are now available.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6 is a platform for Java applications based on JBoss Application Server 7. 

This release serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4.0, and includes bug fixes and enhancements. Documentation for these changes will be available shortly from the Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4.1 Release Notes, linked to in the References. 

All users of Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages. The JBoss server process must be restarted for the update to take effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: AdvancedLdapLodinMogule in Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform (EAP) before 6.4.1 allows attackers to obtain sensitive information via vectors involving logging the LDAP bind credential password when TRACE logging is enabled.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: JBoss EAP: LDAP bind password is being logged with TRACE log level
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

fixed: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the
Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258
